document.heading: Developmental Disabilities Service Management Reform Amendment Act of 2006

history.narrative: Law 16-264, the “Developmental Disabilities Service Management Reform Amendment Act of 2006”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 16-334, which was referred to Committee on Human Services. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 5, 2006, and December 19, 2006, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 28, 2006, it was assigned Act No. 16-620 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 16-264 became effective on March 14, 2007.

container.heading: ESTABLISHMENT OF DEPARTMENT ON DISABILITY SERVICES

para.text: DDS shall collect the contribution to costs of supports from persons with intellectual disabilities who are:
Medicaid Program-eligible but not eligible for the maximum Supplement Security Income or Social Security Disability Insurance payments; or
Not Medicaid Program-eligible but otherwise have been found eligible to receive services from the Developmental Disabilities Administration.
DDS shall collect the contribution to costs of supports under subsection (a) of this section only to the extent that DDS uses local dollars to fund the costs of occupancy.

section.heading: Contribution to Costs of Supports Fund.

para.text: There is established as a special fund the Contribution to Costs of Supports Fund ('Fund'), which shall be administered by DDS in accordance with subsection (c) of this section.
The Fund shall consist of contributions to costs of supports collected by DDS from persons with intellectual disabilities pursuant to section 105b.
The Fund shall be used by DDS to pay the costs of occupancy to persons with intellectual disabilities consistent with federal and local law and regulations.

The money deposited into the Fund, and interest earned, shall not revert to the unrestricted fund balance of the General Fund of the District of Columbia at the end of a fiscal year, or at any other time.
Subject to authorization in an approved budget and financial plan, any funds appropriated in the Fund shall be continually available without regard to fiscal year limitation.
